19namespace ZXing {
20namespace QRCode {
21
22class Version;
23
24/**
25* <p>See ISO 18004:2006, 6.4.1, Tables 2 and 3. This enum encapsulates the various modes in which
26* data can be encoded to bits in the QR code standard.</p>
27*
28* @author Sean Owen
29*/
30class CodecMode
31{
32public:
33 enum Mode
34 {
35 TERMINATOR = 0x00, // Not really a mode...
36 NUMERIC = 0x01,
37 ALPHANUMERIC = 0x02,
38 STRUCTURED_APPEND = 0x03,
39 BYTE = 0x04,
40 FNC1_FIRST_POSITION = 0x05,
41 ECI = 0x07, // character counts don't apply
42 KANJI = 0x08,
43 FNC1_SECOND_POSITION = 0x09,
44 /** See GBT 18284-2000; "Hanzi" is a transliteration of this mode name. */
45 HANZI = 0x0D,
46 };
47
48 /**
49 * @param bits four bits encoding a QR Code data mode
50 * @return Mode encoded by these bits
51 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if bits do not correspond to a known mode
52 */
53 static Mode ModeForBits(int bits);
54
55 /**
56 * @param version version in question
57 * @return number of bits used, in this QR Code symbol {@link Version}, to encode the
58 * count of characters that will follow encoded in this Mode
59 */
60 static int CharacterCountBits(Mode mode, const Version& version);
61};
62
63} // QRCode
64} // ZXing
65
